intro: Uranostachys, commonly known as the golden grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and bright yellow or golden inflorescences. The plants typically grow in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Uranostachys species are often found in temperate regions of Asia and are adapted to thrive in humid environments. Their ornamental value makes them popular in horticultural settings.
